sections.heading: Use of words "farm bureau" restricted to Tennessee Farm Bureau FederationSection 43-22-102 - Other uses of words "farm bureau" unlawful - ExceptionSection 43-22-103 - Federation's permission to use words - Methods of exercisingSection 43-22-104 - Penalty for violation
sections.text:
The use of the words "farm bureau" by any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation, or other business enterprise doing business in the state of Tennessee, except by the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation, or its subsidiaries, or affiliate associations, is unlawful.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 1; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.42 (Williams, § 11412.16); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2301.

The use of the words "farm bureau" by any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation, or other business enterprise doing business in the state of Tennessee, except by the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation, or its subsidiaries, or affiliate associations, is unlawful.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 1; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.42 (Williams, § 11412.16); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2301.

The use of the words "farm bureau" by any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation, or other business enterprise doing business in the state of Tennessee, except by the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation, or its subsidiaries, or affiliate associations, is unlawful.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 1; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.42 (Williams, § 11412.16); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2301.

The use of the words "farm bureau" by any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation, or other business enterprise doing business in the state of Tennessee, except by the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation, or its subsidiaries, or affiliate associations, is unlawful.

Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 1; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.42 (Williams, § 11412.16); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2301.

sections.heading: Other uses of words "farm bureau" unlawful - Exception
sections.text:
The use of the words "farm bureau," either preceded by or followed by the name of any state, county, or town, or by any word designating a product, service, activity, or enterprise in the state of Tennessee, is unlawful; provided, that this shall not limit nor affect the right of the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation, or any of its affiliate associations, to the free use of such words.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 2; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.43 (Williams, § 11412.17); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2302.

The use of the words "farm bureau," either preceded by or followed by the name of any state, county, or town, or by any word designating a product, service, activity, or enterprise in the state of Tennessee, is unlawful; provided, that this shall not limit nor affect the right of the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation, or any of its affiliate associations, to the free use of such words.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 2; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.43 (Williams, § 11412.17); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2302.

The use of the words "farm bureau," either preceded by or followed by the name of any state, county, or town, or by any word designating a product, service, activity, or enterprise in the state of Tennessee, is unlawful; provided, that this shall not limit nor affect the right of the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation, or any of its affiliate associations, to the free use of such words.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 2; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.43 (Williams, § 11412.17); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2302.

The use of the words "farm bureau," either preceded by or followed by the name of any state, county, or town, or by any word designating a product, service, activity, or enterprise in the state of Tennessee, is unlawful; provided, that this shall not limit nor affect the right of the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation, or any of its affiliate associations, to the free use of such words.

Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 2; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.43 (Williams, § 11412.17); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2302.

sections.heading: Federation's permission to use words - Methods of exercising
sections.text:
The Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation may authorize its affiliate or associate organizations, services, or activities to use the words "farm bureau" by resolution duly adopted and spread upon the minutes of its board of directors, a certified copy of which shall be filed with the secretary of state before these words shall be used by any other than the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 3; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.44 (Williams, § 11412.18); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2303.

The Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation may authorize its affiliate or associate organizations, services, or activities to use the words "farm bureau" by resolution duly adopted and spread upon the minutes of its board of directors, a certified copy of which shall be filed with the secretary of state before these words shall be used by any other than the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 3; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.44 (Williams, § 11412.18); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2303.

The Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation may authorize its affiliate or associate organizations, services, or activities to use the words "farm bureau" by resolution duly adopted and spread upon the minutes of its board of directors, a certified copy of which shall be filed with the secretary of state before these words shall be used by any other than the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 3; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.44 (Williams, § 11412.18); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2303.

The Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation may authorize its affiliate or associate organizations, services, or activities to use the words "farm bureau" by resolution duly adopted and spread upon the minutes of its board of directors, a certified copy of which shall be filed with the secretary of state before these words shall be used by any other than the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation.

Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 3; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.44 (Williams, § 11412.18); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2303.

sections.heading: Penalty for violation
sections.text:
Any person, firm, partnership, association, or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter commits a Class C misdemeanor.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 4; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.45 (Williams, § 11412.19); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2304; Acts 1989, ch. 591, § 113.

Any person, firm, partnership, association, or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter commits a Class C misdemeanor.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 4; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.45 (Williams, § 11412.19); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2304; Acts 1989, ch. 591, § 113.

Any person, firm, partnership, association, or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter commits a Class C misdemeanor.Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 4; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.45 (Williams, § 11412.19); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2304; Acts 1989, ch. 591, § 113.

Any person, firm, partnership, association, or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter commits a Class C misdemeanor.

Acts 1949, ch. 46, § 4; C. Supp. 1950, § 552.45 (Williams, § 11412.19); T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 43-2304; Acts 1989, ch. 591, § 113.
